content.rendered:
What is a File Clerk?

File Clerks file forms using special systems of organization.

Where does a File Clerk work?

  • Legal services
  • Administrative offices
  • Data processing companies

How much does a File Clerk make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a File Clerk is $37,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming File Clerks?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business administration majors
  • Office technology majors
Search File Clerk jobs

File Clerk skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring File Clerks succeed in their work:

  • High levels of organization
  • Strong reading and writing skills
  • Concentration

What are some common questions about File Clerks?

Q: What do Files Clerks do?

A: File Clerks sort files and documents, update new and old files alike, and other related activities.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a File Clerk.
